channel.title: Message All on Server
channel.description: I know how to make commands, but I don't know how to make it take my string and sendMessage() to the entire server. Please help

item.title: Message All on Server
item.dc:creator: @altbud altbud
item.description:
@altbud wrote:

I wish I was that brilliant when I’m bored. I have a lot of reading to do. Thank you so much for helping out, everyone who posted :).

item.title: Message All on Server
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“altbud, post:9, topic:296703”][quote author=xslaughter x link=topic=392732.msg2926148#msg2926148 date=1251012063]
This is my command.

       if (command.startsWith("message") && command.length() > 8 && playerRights > 2) {

			String text = command.substring(8);
			yell("[System]:  "  + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
				

}

Put it in client.java
[/quote]

You’re too great :)[/quote]

I got bored so made it myself hehe.

item.title: Message All on Server
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

Here is a method broken down for you:

	public void yell(String message) {
		for (Player p : handler.players) { // loop through all players
			if ((p == null) || !p.isActive) // if they are nulled or inactive skip them
				continue; // prevents the instance from crashing your server
			client temp = (client) p; // making a temp client instance for the player
			if ((temp.absX > 0) && (temp.absY > 0)) // they must be on the map (dunno why lol)
				if ((temp != null) && !temp.disconnected && p.isActive) // final check
					temp.sendMessage(message); // FINALLY sends the player the message
		}
	}

to use:

yell("Hello Server");

Read full topic
